newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian average lending rate eases to 9.9 percent.
newsitem.headline: Croatian average lending rate eases to 9.9 percent.

text.p: Croatian average lending rate eased 20 basis points to 9.9 percent on Tuesday on meagre demand for kuna funds.
Total settlements at 17.4 million kuna were far outstripped by 60 million kuna demand.
Dealers said short term interbank loans ranged between 10 and 15 percent, while insurers' money remained flat at eight percent.
The National Bank of Croatia's kuna midrate for Wednesady was slightly firmer at 5.4566 to the dollar and 3.5589 to the mark. -- Metka Jelenc, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-14557075
